intro: Hepetis paniculata, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It features showy, blue to purple flower clusters that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Hepetis paniculata is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
